title: Fluid Condition
description: Fluid Condition Types operate on a FluidState, essentially which fluid (if any) exists, as well as properties of the fluid. These are available to power/condition types that provides a fluid_condition object field.

type.description: The ID of the Fluid Condition to use

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

then.title: Item Condition
then.description:
Meta Condition Types are independent of the type they operate on. They basically combine or modify other conditions. The conditions which are modified have to be of the type the field of the meta condition requires. For example, if you have a field which requires an Entity Condition Type and you insert an And (Meta Condition Type), the condition types you need to provide inside that condition type will have to be an Entity Condition Type as well.
Type: 'origins:and'
- Checks whether all of the provided conditions are fulfilled.

conditions.description: All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

Type: 'origins:constant'
- Provides a constant state where it's either true or false. Mainly added as a backup case in case a condition is required in some power/action/condition types.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
